gui.ux
Class FactoryPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gui.ux.FactoryPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
GuiInterface, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class FactoryPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, GuiInterface

Contains the primary focus of the Factory simulation, namely all the Factory components.

Author:
David Tan
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

FactoryPanel

public FactoryPanel(MainInterface mainInterface)
Public constructor for FactoryPanel. Initialises everything required to start the actual Factory simulation, and waits for a command from the ControlPanel to start the agent threads. By itself, the FactoryPanel does nothing.

Parameters:
mainInterface - Provides reference to parent JFrame
Method Detail

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
First paints the background with a white rectangle so as to mark the current region being drawn, and then iterates through the guiList ArrayList and calls the updatelocation and draw functions of each element in the ArrayList.

Overrides:
paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
Parameters:
g - Graphics component

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

startThreads

public void startThreads()
Starts all agents in the FactoryPanel and begins the simulation. Should only be called once.

pauseThreads

public void pauseThreads()
Pause all agents in the FactoryPanel, called by stop() in the MainInterface class.

stopThreads

public void stopThreads()
Stop all agents in the FactoryPanel, should only be used internally.

drain

public void drain()
Drains the chocolate ocean in which all GUI agents operate. Doing so shuts down every GUI agent and removes the ability to enable them.

wave

public void wave()
Draws a wave that completely cripples the factory and forces a reset.

bubble

public void bubble()
Sends all candies in the nests and lanes into bubbles and floats them away.

revolt

public void revolt()
Causes all the Oompa Loompa robots to revolt and stop working; all of the robots will then move randomly around on the screen and will continue to do so until the Factory simulation is completely reset.

setConfiguration

public void setConfiguration(java.util.HashMap<structures.PartType,java.lang.Integer> param)
Sets a new kit configuration for use by the kitRobotAgent.

Parameters:
param - Kit configuration
